events.message: The customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on the morning of April 30th involving their car and another vehicle at an intersection.
Upon initial review, the claim was categorized under Auto Accident due to the involvement of a car collision as described by the customer.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to assist the customer through the claim process and provide necessary guidance.
The agent sent a confirmation email acknowledging receipt of the claim and outlining the next steps for the customer.
To proceed with the investigation, the agent requested photos of the damaged vehicle, a police report, and the customer’s insurance policy documents.
The customer uploaded all requested documents including multiple photos of the accident damage and the official police accident report.
Our claims investigation team began reviewing the submitted documents and contacting relevant parties to assess liability and damage extent.
The investigation was completed with a determination that the customer’s vehicle sustained considerable damage while not being at fault.
We offered a settlement proposal based on repair estimates and coverage limits to compensate the customer for the vehicle damage.
The customer responded approving the settlement offer and expressed appreciation for the timely communication and assistance.
Following customer approval, the claim was formally approved to move forward with issuing payment for repairs.
The payment covering the approved settlement amount was successfully issued to the customer’s account.
The claim was officially closed after confirming receipt of payment and satisfaction from the customer with the resolution.
All claim documents and correspondence were archived securely for future reference and compliance requirements.
